Request for Information (RFI)

Contracted Maintenance, Modification, Aircrew, and Related Services (CMMARS) Follow-On

**This RFI includes multiple North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) codes. Interested businesses can provide one consolidated response.**

The CMMARS follow-on contract vehicle will be used by several Government entities such as Naval Fleet activities, and NAVAIR Program Offices.  Non-Navy customers will also be able to use the established contract vehicle.  The COMFRC Acquisition Group will support Government customers in the development of acquisition documentation, requirements development, Requests for Proposals (RFPs), conduct of source selections, retention and the use of lessons learned.  The COMFRC Acquisition Group has two primary goals: improving the quality of contracted services and shortening the procurement lead time to award.

This is the first RFI issued for planning purposes for the CMMARS Follow-on contract.  Both large and small businesses are encouraged to respond.

The CMMARS follow-on will be a Multiple Award Contract (MAC) Indefinite-Delivery Indefinite-Quantity (IDIQ) contract.  The CMMARS follow-on MAC and associated task orders will be used to procure CLS for maintenance, modification, aircrew and related services for aviation platforms and associated equipment.  Additionally, the CMMARS follow-on MAC will be used for heavy depot maintenance requirements and workload to augment the organic capabilities of the depots. 

The Government plans to award the CMMARS follow-on under one or more of the following NAICS Codes: 488190: Aircraft ferrying services, aircraft inspection services, aircraft maintenance and repair services (except factory conversion, factory overhaul, factory rebuilding), aircraft testing services, fueling aircraft on a contract or fee basis, independent pilot, air (except owner-operators), inspection services, aircraft testing services;  336411:  Aircraft Manufacturing (manufacturing or assembling complete aircraft; developing and making aircraft prototypes; aircraft conversion (i.e., major modifications to systems); and complete aircraft overhaul and rebuilding (i.e., periodic restoration of aircraft to approved design specifications); 336412:  Aircraft engine repair/overhaul, Aircraft engine rebuilding; and 336413:  Aircraft Propeller repair/overhaul and Aircraft Landing Gear repair/overhaul.

Description Text:
The following notice is published for informational purposes only. This is not a request by the Government for submittal of proposals or quotes of any kind.
The Government intends to issue, on a Sole Source basis, an Indefinite Delivery/Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) contract to Leonardo MW Ltd located at 2 Crewe Road North, Edinburgh, EH5 2XS. This procurement is for material, engineering, and sustainment support for the Vixen 500 Active Electronically Scanned Array (AESA) Radar which is installed on the United States Navy Test Pilot School (USNTPS) C-26 aircraft for training with the Airborne Systems Training and Research Support (ASTARS) system. The resultant contract will be primarily Firm Fixed Price with a Five year ordering period. The IDIQ contract will have a FFP Over & Above CLIN to incorporate manufacturer radar upgrades, a CPFF Labor CLIN for ASTARS engineering support & radar system troubleshooting, a COST Travel CLIN and a Not Separately Priced CLIN for the Contract Data Requirements List (CDRLs) using negotiations on a sole source basis in accordance with FAR Part 15 procedures.  
As Sources Sought was posted on Federal Business Opportunity on May 15, 2018, only one response was received. Therefore, FAR 6.302-1 (Only One Responsible Source and No Other Supplies or Services Will Satisfy Agency Requirements) is the authority under which sole source will be used. Leonardo is the only company that has the technical support to the Vixen 500 AESA Radar. This radar system has specific components such as the antenna, processor, power supply, navigation unit, liquid cooling unit and inertial measurement unit (IMU) that can be procured from the original equipment manufacturer (OEM) or repaired by an authorized vendor.  Leonardo has the required technical data and specialized test equipment to evaluate, troubleshoot, repair and calibrate the Vixen 500 radar components. With Leonardo being the OEM, they can provide technical support to the US Navy Test Pilot School to include access to replacement parts on the Vixen 500 radar.  This agreement benefits the Government because as Leonardo is the OEM, it is critical that the radar system be maintained to support the test pilot school to ensure test pilot students complete their training syllabus to become qualified Test Pilots, Test Flight Officers and Test Project Engineers. Under FAR 6.302-1, Leonardo is the only source that has the technical data, knowledge, experience, and capability necessary to fulfill the Government's need and meet its requirements within the defined schedule.

Solicitation Title: Sources Sought for C-26 CLS
Description Text:
C-26 Sources Sought25 April 2018The Tactical Airlift Program Office, PMA207 at the Naval Air Systems Command (NAVAIR), Patuxent River, MD is conducting a Market Survey of Industry to determine potential interested Small Business sources that have the skills and experience required to successfully provide Contractor Logistics Support (CLS) for the C-26 platform.This Sources Sought is a Request for Information (RFI) for market survey purposes only to determine the small business capability to meet this requirement. This is not a solicitation for proposals and no contract shall be awarded from this announcement. The purpose of this announcement is for Market Research only and is in accordance with (IAW) Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) Part 10 and is being issued IAW FAR subpart 15.201(e).  No reimbursement shall be made for any costs associated with providing information in response to this announcement or any follow up information requests. Nothing shall be construed herein or through this market research process to commit or obligate the Government to further action as a result of this research.Program Description:The C-26 aircraft is a Metroliner SA-227 Series manufactured by Fairchild Industries.  It is a high-performance, fixed-wing, pressurized, twin-engine turboprop that accommodates a pilot, co-pilot, up to 19 passengers, or cargo.  The aircraft provide on-call, rapid response cargo and passenger flights, and test and training range support.  The C-26 aircraft program is in the sustainment phase and has been continuously maintained under a competitive CLS services contract since fleet introduction. The locations for services on the eight C-26 aircraft are:·  Pacific Missile Range Facility (PMRF) Barking Sands, Hawaii - 1 (EC-26D) and 2 (RC-26D)·  Naval Air Station (NAS) Sigonella, Italy - 2 (C-26D)·  Naval Support Activity (NSA) Naples, Italy - 2 (C-26D) ·  NAS Patuxent River, MD- 1 (C-26A)NOTE:  The C-26 CLS consists of maintenance and supply support in compliance with DCMA 8210.1 series oversight procedures and consists of the management and performance of the following services at Main Operating Base (MOB) sites:·   Line maintenance·   Global spares support·   Engine, props, and aircraft inspections and repair·   Aircraft modificationsThe C-26 are Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) type-certificated, commercial-derivative aircraft modified with Navy and Marine Corps required items, supported and maintained in accordance with 14 CFR, Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) maintenance plan, and Navy Instructions.  Maintenance or repair may be accomplished by the MOB site maintainers; an OEM authorized Service Center, or a FAA-certified or European Aviation Safety Agency (EASA)/Certified Part 145 repair station.The prime contractor will need to establish working relationships with the OEMs to access data to fulfill the requirements and support the C-26 fleet for the airframe, engines, propellers, accessories, and systems.Responsible sources are encouraged to submit a capability statement that addresses their ability to perform the full range of CLS services described above at the platform level across ALL listed locations. The scope of the CLS services includes organizational and depot maintenance for aircraft, aircraft subsystems, support equipment, and related equipment at sites both inside and outside the continental United States.Interested contractors shall submit responses by email to Ron Hickman, at ronald.a.hickman@navy.mil.  The capability statement package (no more than FIFTEEN single-sided 8.5 X 11 inch pages, font no smaller than 10 point) should demonstrate the ability to provide the requirement as listed above. Solicitation Title: Walk Behind Powered Aircraft Tug
Description Text: Solicitation Notice: The United States Garrison, Fort Leavenworth Kansas, has a need to purchase an electrically powered walk behind aircraft tug. This procurement is for the acquisition of commercial items using simplified acquisition procedures in accordance with FAR Part 13. The North American Industrial Classification System (NAICS) number is 336413 and the business size standard is 1250 Employees. Salient Characteristics of Aircraft Tug:-Electrically powered, walk behind configuration for precise movement of military fixed-wing aircraft into and out of hangar.-35,000lb tow capacity.-Must be able to cradle dual nose wheels, such as though on C-12 and C-26 aircraft, as well as single nose wheel configurations as found on the UC-35,C-21, et al.-Utilize a "Lazy Susan" platform to place (cradle) the nose wheel on the tug unit, rather than the traditional tractor-and-tow-bar aircraft tug. This allows for precise maneuvering of aircraft, and greatly improved traction for the tug unit when operating on slick surfaces.Please SUBMIT a quote at this time. Any offerors believing they can provide the required aircraft tug with all of the features and functions of the requirement described above may submit a quote. The quote must support salient characteristics of the requested aircraft tug. All qualified sources may submit a response, which if timely received, will be considered by this agency. Responses must be received NLT 0800 pm Central Standard Time (CST) on 10 May 2018. Responses received after this will be considered late IAW FAR 52.212-1 and will not be evaluated. The Government does not intend to pay for any information provided under this announcement. Contractors must have a current registration with the System of Award Management (SAM).The Government intends to award a Firm Fixed Price contract processed IAW FAR Part 12 and 13.
